answers.answer: Hi. Thank you for your story. If you believe God to give you & your husband a child; then He will. God is not a liar. It is His will for us to have children. I don't know if you read the Bible, but read about faith. You can go to www.Biblegateway.com & type in "faith" in the keywords. Hebrews 11:1 says " Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen." Also, read about a woman in the Bible, Hannah who was barren & was taunted by another woman (Peninnah) who were having children (read in 1 Samuel). Hannay prayed to God for a child & God blessed her to give birth to Samuel. Then God blessed her with other children. If you want a child, you have to believe. I have a friend who prayed & believe God to give her a daughter. She bought the baby's clothes years before she became pregnant. Well, her daughter (my goddaughter), Megan is now 5. She just finished pre k. She is my heart. She prays for me & it comes to pass. God promised me a daughter, then later a son. My daughter's name is Elizabeth Marie; God gave us the names. My son name will be Elijah. Again, God named him. God told me to buy my daughter clothes; which I have. I have started decorating her room. Again, God told me. I believe Him because God doesn't give us a promise that He won't keep. God keeps His Words. I am a believer. I pray for your faith. I also pray for your healing. Be blessed.

BP is treatable in pregnancy and so is diabetes.  Why do you think you should not try for a baby?  I would suggest talking to your OB/GYN about the prospect and see what he thinks in your particular situation.  I know that Aldomet is considered safe in pregnancy but it does not work for me so I will be taking toprol during pregnancy.  Im not a diabetic but I am overweight.  I know that gestetational diabetes is treated.  Dont give up thinking of having your own child, speak to a specialist and see what can be done.  Wishing you the best!Ginger
